message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of irregular nuclei in large lymphocytes suggests a possible diagnosis of primary central nervous system lymphoma. Methotrexate is considered the first-line treatment for this condition. Intrathecal glucocorticoids and temozolomide may be used as adjunctive therapies, but surgical resection is not typically indicated in the treatment of primary central nervous system lymphoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggest a lymphoma. Methotrexate is a chemotherapy drug commonly used to treat lymphomas. Surgical resection may be an option for brain tumors, but in this case, the biopsy showed involvement of multiple large lymphocytes, making surgical resection less effective. Intrathecal glucocorticoids and Temozolomide are not commonly used to treat lymphomas.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggest a possible diagnosis of primary central nervous system lymphoma. Methotrexate is the standard treatment for this condition. Surgical resection may be done in some cases as an adjunctive therapy, but it is not the primary treatment option. Intrathecal glucocorticoids are not effective in treating primary CNS lymphoma, and temozolomide is used in the treatment of other types of brain tumors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggest a possible diagnosis of primary central nervous system lymphoma. Methotrexate is the most effective treatment for this type of lymphoma. Surgical resection may not be feasible given the location of the lesion, and intrathecal glucocorticoids and temozolomide are not as effective as methotrexate for this type of lymphoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggest lymphoma. Methotrexate is a chemotherapy drug commonly used to treat lymphoma. Surgical resection may be appropriate for some brain tumors, but it is not the first-line treatment for lymphoma. Intrathecal glucocorticoids are used in the treatment of leukemia, but not lymphoma. Temozolomide is used in the treatment of glioblastoma multiforme but is not typically used in the treatment of lymphoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggests a diagnosis of primary central nervous system lymphoma. Methotrexate is the most appropriate treatment for this condition. Intrathecal glucocorticoids may have a role in the treatment of leptomeningeal spread, but would not be the primary treatment for the brain lesion. Temozolomide may be used in combination with radiation therapy for glioblastoma but would not be the primary treatment for primary CNS lymphoma. Surgical resection may be used for certain brain lesions, but would not be appropriate for a primary CNS lymphoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of large, irregular lymphocytes suggests a diagnosis of lymphoma. Chemotherapy with methotrexate is a common treatment for lymphoma. Intrathecal glucocorticoids are used to treat CNS involvement in lymphoma, while temozolomide is used to treat glioblastoma, and surgical resection may not be feasible in a brain lesion.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggests lymphoma, and methotrexate is a chemotherapy agent commonly used for lymphoma treatment. Intrathecal glucocorticoids may be used to treat lymphoma involving the central nervous system, but surgical resection is not typically used for lymphoma treatment. Temozolomide is used for treatment of glioblastoma multiforme, not lymphoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggests a lymphoma. Methotrexate is commonly used for the treatment of lymphoma. Surgical resection may be considered for certain brain tumors, but it is not a first-line treatment for lymphoma. Intrathecal glucocorticoids are not typically used for the treatment of brain tumors. Temozolomide is used in the treatment of gliomas, not lymphomas.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The large lymphocytes with irregular nuclei suggest a diagnosis of primary CNS lymphoma. Methotrexate is the most common treatment for primary CNS lymphoma. Surgical resection is not recommended as the tumor is usually diffuse and involves multiple areas of the brain. Intrathecal glucocorticoids and temozolomide are not the standard treatment for primary CNS lymphoma.
